entry.title: PEPE Holder Turns $250 into $1M in Four Days. But Can They Sell It?
entry.summary: A memecoin investor has turned $250 into $1.02 million—but liquidity issues could prevent them from realizing that profit.

entry.title: Over $250 Million in Liquidations as Bitcoin, Ethereum Slip
entry.summary: Bitcoin dropped to just over $29,000 overnight, while Ethereum slumped by 6% on the day to slip below $2,000.

entry.title: A Brief History of Artificial Intelligence (AI): From Turing to IoT
entry.summary: Artificial intelligence (AI) as a concept dates back to ancient times, but modern AI began in the mid-20th century with pioneers like Alan Turing.

entry.title: Hong Kong Is Vying To Be The Next Crypto Hub
entry.summary: Hong Kong has historically provided fertile soil to grow financial institutions. Can it also make magic for crypto firms?

entry.title: New Frontiers: Jeremy Booth Lassos More Western Artists Into Web3
entry.summary: The NFT artist announced the Western Art Dept, an initiative to bring more traditional Western-themed artists into the Web3 space.

entry.title: A Hacker Has Stolen $10 Million in Ethereum and No One Knows How
entry.summary: A hacker has been targeting OG crypto users since December, draining their wallets and leaving experts baffled.

entry.title: AI Oasis Tribute Album Sparks Debate Over Copyright and the Future of Music
entry.summary: AI revives Oasis’ distinctive sound, raising complicated questions about the intersection of creativity and technology.

entry.title: Did Gary Gensler Pull a Kim Kardashian by 'Shilling' Algorand?
entry.summary: Years before the SEC labeled it a security, Gensler called Algorand “great technology” and “brilliant work.”

entry.title: Gensler Is Driving Crypto to Communist China, Says Republican Congressman
entry.summary: GOP lawmakers blasted the SEC Chairman today during a hearing, with Rep. Tom Emmer (R-MN) the most scathing.

entry.title: This Upgrade Could Make It Harder for Governments to Censor Bitcoin
entry.summary: The more influential Bitcoin becomes, the greater the risk of attack.

entry.title: Trump Drops More NFTs—And Now the First Batch Is Plummeting in Price
entry.summary: Trump wants “‘NICE GUY’ CREDIT” after dropping more $99 NFTs, but his first set of collectibles have fallen by over 50% on the secondary market.

entry.title: Lack of Crypto Compliance Is SEC's Fault, Say Republican Lawmakers
entry.summary: The letter accuses the agency boss of cramming the digital assets industry into an improper regulatory framework.

entry.title: Jeremy Cowart to Create 10,000 Photo NFTs in 20 Minutes—In Front of an Audience
entry.summary: Award-winning photographer Jeremy Cowart will produce the NFTs live in Nashville, in partnership with OpenSea and Transient Labs.

entry.title: Gala v2 Airdrop Announced: What You Need to Know
entry.summary: GALA holders are scheduled for an airdrop in May but should be wary of keeping their funds in exchanges, liquidity pools, or smart contracts.

entry.title: How Artificial Intelligence Can Revolutionize Supply Chain Optimization
entry.summary: A look at how AI can be used to take on—and improve—the optimization of a supply chain.

entry.title: UK ‘Moving Fast’ on Crypto Regulations, Says Coinbase CEO
entry.summary: Amid the latest crypto crackdown in the United States, Coinbase CEO Brian Armstrong appears to be turning to the UK and Europe.

entry.title: SEC Granted Access to Singapore Records for Terra's Do Kwon
entry.summary: A judge rejected Do Kwon's request to block SEC access to documents related to Terraform Labs’ activities in Singapore.

entry.title: Can AI Save Journalism From Fake News? Not Yet, But These Tools Can Help
entry.summary: The advent of accessible AI makes it easier than ever to create fake images. But AI language tools can also help debunk false information.

entry.title: Crypto Bumped to the Back Seat as AI Investments Accelerate
entry.summary: Mysten Labs CEO Evan Cheng says AI’s broad consumer appeal has VCs shifting gears.

entry.title: Nike Unveils First .Swoosh NFT Digital Sneaker Drop
entry.summary: The “Our Force 1" collection will potentially consist of hundreds of thousands of virtual pairs of the brand’s iconic Air Force 1 sneaker.

entry.title: Paxful CEO Says Users Can Withdraw Funds—But They Say Otherwise
entry.summary: Paxful customers are angry that they still cannot withdraw their funds while the company's ex-boss claims otherwise.

entry.title: Google CEO: We’re Not Ready for Advanced AI
entry.summary: Experts warn that AI could harm humans but also say the future may be brighter than we think.

entry.title: SEC Labels Algorand and Five Other Tokens as Securities in Bittrex Lawsuit
entry.summary: A legal expert said the coins’ inclusion resembles another SEC lawsuit brought against a former Coinbase employee.

entry.title: Starbucks Odyssey Launch ‘Getting Closer’ With New NFTs, Rewards
entry.summary: The coffee giant will drop its second NFT collection this week, and teased the public rollout for its Web3 platform.

entry.title: Bitcoin Fund Inflows Top $100M in One Week as Investors 'Flee to Safety'
entry.summary: Big investors continue to feel optimistic about Bitcoin, according to a Monday CoinShares report, with over $104 million of inflows.

entry.title: SEC Charges Bittrex, Former CEO for Operating Unregistered Securities Exchange
entry.summary: The lawsuit also names six tokens as securities, including Algorand.

entry.title: EU Lawmakers Call for 'Human-centric, Safe and Trustworthy' AI Development
entry.summary: Politicians working on the EU’s response to AI development want the bloc to work with the U.S. on a "human-centric" solution.

entry.title: Australians Lost $148M in Crypto to Scammers in 2022
entry.summary: Scams continued to plague Australians in 2022, with crypto payments seeing a hefty uptick compared to the previous year.

entry.title: Bittrex Faces Potential Enforcement Action From The SEC: Report
entry.summary: The SEC has reportedly told the Seattle-based Bittrex of a potential enforcement action against the crypto exchange.

entry.title: Shaq Finally Served in FTX Lawsuit After Months of ‘Running’, Say Lawyers
entry.summary: Shaq has finally been served after allegedly “running” from legal complaints over his promotion of the fallen crypto exchange FTX.

entry.title: What Is zkEVM? The Zero-Knowledge Proof's Role in Smart Contracts
entry.summary: The emerging zkEVM ecosystem will allow the Ethereum blockchain to bolster secure transaction scalability — while preserving key functions and features of its virtual machine.

entry.title: Ethereum Tapers Gains After 12% Rise Post-Shanghai
entry.summary: Significant withdrawals after the Shanghai upgrade and the dollar's strength may be weighing on the second-largest cryptocurrency.

entry.title: NFT NYC Again Showcased the Resilience of Web3 Culture
entry.summary: From an NFT scavenger hunt to NFT-enabled physical fashion, there was a lot to like at NFT NYC, even amid an extended bear market.

entry.title: Hacker Exploits Hundred Finance Protocol In $7.4 Million Heist
entry.summary: The multi-chain lending protocol hopes to contact its attacker as the HND token value falls 46%.

entry.title: This Week in Coins: Bitcoin Recovers $30K as Ethereum’s 'Shapella' Goes Live
entry.summary: Beyond the numbers, there were many reasons why this was a good week in coins.

entry.title: NFT Artist Jeremy Booth Wrangles with Western-Themed ‘Outlaws’ Collection
entry.summary: The PFP project launch sparked a debate over the line between plagiarism and inspiration for digital art.

entry.title: gm: Anthony Scaramucci Is More Bullish on Bitcoin Than Ever
entry.summary: Anthony Scaramucci of hedge fund SkyBridge Capital got burned by Sam Bankman-Fried: he co-hosted SALT conferences with FTX and sold a 30% stake in SkyBridge to FTX Ventures. And yet "The Mooch" tells Dan Roberts and Stacy Elliott "I'm more bullish now than I have ever been" on crypto as an investment case. He discusses his frustration with SBF, how wrong he thinks politicians like Elizabeth Warren and Gary Gensler are about crypto and how to regulate it, what he sees happening next with adoption, and talks about Trump. Watch and make sure to subscribe to the gm podcast on Apple or Spotify.

entry.title: Coinbase Chief Legal Officer: The Problem With SEC's Howey Test Isn't Its Age
entry.summary: Coinbase Chief Legal Officer Paul Grewal discussed the "Howey Test," which the SEC uses as its yard stick for whether a crypto asset should be regulated as a security, and told Decrypt's Stacy Elliott and Dan Roberts the issue with it isn't that it's old (the case is from 1946) but how it's being applied to modern technology. Watch and make sure to subscribe to the gm podcast on Apple or Spotify.

entry.title: Decentralized Pictures Plots Its Next Web3 Grant for Filmmakers
entry.summary: Leo Matchett from Web3 film funding platform Decentralized Pictures tells Decrypt's Jason Nelson at Outer Edge LA about DCP's just announced iPhone Filmmaking Initiative, which will support aspiring filmmakers who create a short film on their iPhones, and will be determined via DCP's crypto-native on-chain voting system.

entry.title: Web3 YouTuber CryptoStache: Gaming Will Be the Catalyst That Takes NFTs Mainstream
entry.summary: Web3 gaming YouTuber CryptoStache talks to Decrypt's Jason Nelson at Outer Edge LA about why Web3 gaming will bring NFTs mainstream, the partnerships that prove it's already happening, how gamers will change their tune on NFTs, and how the terminology is likely to change.

entry.title: Fordefi Aims to Dramatically Simplify the Institutional Crypto Wallet
entry.summary: Steve H., VP of sales from Fordefi, which raised $18 million in funding last year, tells Decrypt's Jason Nelson at Outer Edge LA how Fordefi uses multi-party computation to make signing transactions on an institutional crypto wallet much simpler—no seed phrase needed.

entry.title: gm: Canadian Bitcoin Miner Hut 8 Is Heading West
entry.summary: Toronto-based Bitcoin mining company Hut 8 recently announced a merger with U.S. Bitcoin Corp that will take it into Texas, Nebraska, and New York. Hut 8 CEO Jaime Leverton joined Dan Roberts and Stacy Elliott to talk expanding into the U.S., dealing with regulatory pushback post-FTX, why Texas is such a hotspot, and where she'd like to expand globally down the road (the climates may surprise you). Watch and make sure to subscribe to the gm podcast on Apple or Spotify.

entry.title: gm: Kevin Owocki Wants to Regenerate DeFi
entry.summary: Move over, DeFi—ReFi is coming? Gitcoin founder Kevin Owocki has stepped away from DeFi grant-giving machine Gitcoin as it fully decentralizes and is now focused on regenerative finance (huh?) and ReFi incubator Supermodular. He aims to "regenerate the regenerators." He explained it all to Dan Roberts and Liam Kelly, and also talks DAO structure, crypto factions, NFT use cases, his book "Greenpilled," and much more. Watch and make sure to subscribe to the gm podcast on Apple or Spotify.

entry.title: Why Aurory's Head of Production Left Ubisoft for Web3
entry.summary: Aurory executive producer and head of production Jonathan Campeau tells Decrypt's Kate Irwin at GDC about how the first-generation of Web3 games came out of DeFi and are now evolving.

entry.title: 'We Don't Really Do the Corporate Thing Very Well' Says Jason Brink on Gala Games Approach
entry.summary: With roughly 50 video games in its pipeline, Gala Games is all-in on Web3. Gala's President of Blockchain Jason Brink told Decrypt's Kate Irwin at GDC about the studio's ethos and weighs in on the different approaches to Web3 gaming.

entry.title: gm: Coinbase's Top Lawyer Gets Real on SEC
entry.summary: Paul Grewal is the Chief Legal Officer at Coinbase and a former U.S. magistrate judge in Northern California. He gave Dan Roberts and Stacy Elliott his candid takes on Sam Bankman-Fried and FTX, the SEC's crackdown on staking, the sanctioning of Tornado Cash, and more alpha on how Coinbase is approaching the current unfriendly US regulatory environment. Watch and make sure to subscribe to the gm podcast on Apple or Spotify.

entry.title: The Founder of Rotten Tomatoes Says Web3 Entertainment Isn’t Nearly Entertaining Enough Yet
entry.summary: Rotten Tomatoes founder Patrick Lee, who has led companies at the intersection of technology and entertainment from Web1 to Web3, spoke to Decrypt's Sander Lutz at Outer Edge LA about the current state of decentralized gaming, film and television.

entry.title: gm: How Gnosis Has Endured and Evolved
entry.summary: Gnosis first launched in 2015 as a decentralized prediction market built on Ethereum. Now it's a DAO, a multi-sig wallet, a staking chain, and a vibrant community with its own GNO governance token. Co-founder and COO Friederike Ernst talked to Dan Roberts and Stacy Elliott about the careful evolution of Gnosis, decentralization impostors, account abstraction, DeFi UX failures, why Ethereum is the "Manhattan of crypto," and much more. Watch and make sure to subscribe to the gm podcast on Apple or Spotify.

entry.title: Justin Aversano's Inspiration for Tarot-Themed NFT Photo Series 'Smoke and Mirrors'
entry.summary: Justin Aversano, best known for his high-selling "Twin Flames" NFT photo series, joined Decrypt’s Andrew Hayward ahead of the upcoming L.A. exhibition for his new Ethereum NFT project "Smoke and Mirrors." He shared the wild inspiration behind the tarot-themed collection, and why—despite his growing profile—he opted not to exhibit at a major brand-name gallery.

entry.title: Midnight Society’s Rob Bowling Talks Deadrop Launch and Working With Dr. Disrespect
entry.summary: Former "Call of Duty" developer Rob Bowling, now head of Midnight Society Studio, checked in with Decrypt's Kate Irwin at GDC and shared some behind-the-scenes statistics on how players are enjoying "Deadrop." The game saw 90,000 player hours over the weekend, with 97 minutes average play time per player, and their community size tripled in just a few days.
